Important Announcement For All Users
Monster Rancher Metropolis: The Cafe: Archived Topics From Prior Years: Year 2002 Topics ( Year Of The Password): Important Announcement For All Users
By Lisa Shock on Monday, June 3, 2002 - 09:30 pm:

Due to unresolvable problems with an underage user who refuses to stop trying to get me jailed, I have closed the site to public posting. From now on, everyone must have an account to post anywhere on the site.

I am deeply saddened by this. I wanted to keep old-fashioned values alive here, but it's just not possible anymore. I have kept the "anonymous" option, so you can get an account then post as "anonymous" if you like.

By The D on Monday, June 3, 2002 - 09:35 pm:

See what happens when you do stupid things like this. You ruin for the people who are not regular users and just want to post. But now they got to register. That is pretty sad man.

By mepersoner on Monday, June 3, 2002 - 10:53 pm:

That stinks...

It's for the best though.

By Medjai on Monday, June 3, 2002 - 11:08 pm:

You did what you had to do.

By torey luvullo on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 03:56 am:

By Terance on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 10:09 am:

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 10:32 am:

I can usually set up accounts fairly fast, especially for people I know have been around for a while.

By SlapShotz54 on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 02:11 pm:

By Djinnmastr on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 06:09 pm:

just out of curiosity, who was this ***** that ruined it for everyone? And why couldn't you just block his ISP?

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 10:28 pm:

An AOL user going by the names "Suezo Master", Joker2Ghost" and "Joker Ghost". AOL is a nightmare, if you ban any IP you may be banning a large chunk of the US, because they are different each time a person logs on.

By The D on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 10:31 pm:

You won't ever come down to banning out AOL users period, because of someone else??

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 11:09 pm:

No, I won't dis-allow AOL users as a group. Some of our best researchers use AOL. Each person is now really responsible for their actions with their board names, and that name will be banned and all posts by that person deleted if they get into trouble.

IP banning is now pointless for the most part. -Unless I suspect some has hacked into an account, in which case I can always delete the account until the real owner of it returns online.

I can view IPs in emails, and have a pretty good idea of who is whom from that. Even within AOL, there are regional markers.

And, like always, I can register complaints with people's ISPs if they do anything really bad.

By Lisa Shock on Tuesday, June 4, 2002 - 11:15 pm:

Also, everyone, please read the section on accounts in the Office Of The Mayor carefully. I really need all 5 items to make an account for you.

By Flare Reiketsu on Wednesday, June 5, 2002 - 06:47 am:

Joker Ghost? I don't remember him saying anything about getting you jailed... What did you do, delete 99% of his posts? Probably...

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, June 5, 2002 - 11:28 am:

It has to do with violating the under 13 law, COPPA, without written consent from his legal guardian. He receieved several email warnings with regards to this.
